result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John Joseph Perry-Rydz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kevin M Smith appeared by video for John Joseph Perry-Rydz. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on August 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.
